title: Pink Floyd The Wall 1982 DVDR ENG R4 NTSC
description:
Based in the historic 1979 album by English band Pink Floyd, the film Pink Floyd The Wall is considered a classic of world cinema by portraying through the memorable scenes that Roger Waters represented with beautiful compositions and exciting lyrics, portraying his most sincere feelings of time.
The film tells the story of Pink, a frustrated rocker, who feels abandoned by parents in the world, the fame, the woman, blaming them for their isolation and dissatisfaction. His father was killed in the war to defend the homeland and not left good memories, his overprotective mother stopped to evolve as a man, his wife left him for another man and teachers and school - so well portrayed in the film - the oppressed by writing poems and music.
With all these reasons we finally got to the analogy of the name given to the movie: The Wall. Pink goes on to build a wall to get away from the rest of the world, where each of these reasons is part of that wall.
The most amazing movie is due to the fact that very few speeches, being told through the songs on the album The Wall and its exciting letters. This proves that Waters ever saw a movie in your head when composing what would be considered one of the best albums of progressive rock and one of the best films of the year.
